metadata.name: The literary envoy of Vigo
metadata.description:
Once upon a time, the father of science fiction, Jules Gabriel Verne, the literary envoy of Vigo, was sitting thoughtfully against the beautiful view of the city. 

Watching Vigo city like this, those who saw it couldn't make sense of it. Because he was supposed to be happy at the top of the stairs that he climbed, on the tentacles of the cuttlefish, with the achievements that he had achieved as a result of his work for many years. A woman who was curious about this situation decided to go out into his presence to talk to him. But for this he had to climb the stairs and be patient. When the woman began to climb the stairs decking out among these bronze-colored rocks, she thought about how difficult it was to achieve this feat. 

When he came to her after a hard journey, he realized why she was actually thoughtful. Verne had achieved success with the science fiction books he had written, but in order for success to be permanent, it was necessary to be recognized and approachable...
